pullRequest.title: Issue 4978: DeltaIterator NullPointerException.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Change log description

This PR adds logic to prevent a NullPointException when a TableSegment has no entries to iterate over (relative to the provided fromPosition). This can occur during two situations: an empty segment with length == 0 or when the fromPosition provided in the request exceeds the segment length.

Purpose of the change
Fixes #4978
What the code does

This code makes sure that the result.state field is initialized before being accessed in any way. Add a new method that (given the table segment to iterate over and the from position) sets up the state, assuming that no iteration has taken place yet.

The following semantics of the response has changed as follows:

If the PravegaRequestProcessor is provided a fromPosition value that exceeds the segment length, it will return a lastPosition value equal to the length of the segment.

It may also return shouldClear as true (defined using the same condition as before) even though it did not iterate over any entries.


An empty segment is treated the same as above.

How to verify it

Run unit tests. Added new unit tests for both situations.

commit.message:
Implement overrides for classes extending `FailingReplyProcessor`.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Improve codecov.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText: It should be enough to implement this once on FailingReplyProcessor; if you observe - all the classes where you overrode this method do more or less the same thing. You can just write it once.
Looks like this is not covered by unit tests. Please add unit tests for this class.

commit.message:
Refactor the implementation of `errorMessage` and add segment to ErrorMessage.

nodes.bodyText: Please indent this line like the other ones above and below.
You don't need ? : here. Change == to != and return the result.
This is not going to propagate up to the caller.
This is not used. A request should be sent and the reply returned should be verified.
All of the classes that extend FailingReplyProcessor should be modifed to properly handle the error.

nodes.bodyText: I'm not quite sure on the performance impact (if any) but certain properties about the Segment are needed to define some DeltaIteratorState instance. It did not seem feasible to be able to use the information acquired in ContainerTableExtensionImpl.newDeltaIterator as that would require several changes about the semantics of the iteration across several classes.

commit.message:
* Simplify fix by throwing InvalidArgumentException if the fromPosition argument exceeds the segment length.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

* Add generic ErrorMessage WireCommand response.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText: I chose to include a Class -> ErrorCode map because presumably we will need some translation logic to turn a given exception into some error code. Including this logic in here prevents a (potentially) continuously growing if/else-if block in PravegaRequestProcessor.handleException.
While this may increase the risk of a NullPointerException, null appears to be a valid return for unknown causes (see: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html#getCause--).

commit.message:
* 'Implement' method in test class.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText: Message may be null. Be sure to account for that.

Here you are changing the behavior for this class. You should make sure that ErrorMessage only captures those exceptions that it can properly send a message back for, and let the rest fall down to this default behavior. We have a lot of code (on the other side of the Wire Protocol) that relies on these connections to be closed when something unexpected happens.
It is true that we will eventually want to "fix" that code to understand proper error codes, but that is not a task I believe you are willing to undertake now, are you? It's OK to file  follow up issue (not necessarily for yourself) to look at this new Wire Command and make any proper changes (like handling specific errors, etc.) - we can do that later.

nodes.bodyText: This may not necessarily be on a TableSegment. I'd remove that (leave the rest of the message as-is).
Is there a reason (for this PR) that IllegalStateException is also included here? The old behavior was that it would close the connection in this case.
You have 2 extra spaces here (before void and after throws. Same with the methods below.
I can see the numbers have not been kept organized as originally intended. However let's make an attempt to prevent it from getting worse. Let's make this one's code 61.

This class should override isFailure to return true.
Also move this to be located next to AuthTokenCheckFailed.
